content.description: Monica and Chandler’s apartment, everyone except Ross is decorating the tree.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let me ask you, why is everybody using these tiny lights nowadays? I remember when people used to use big lights.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s a good story, Grandpa.
(Ross enters)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, Monica’s letting other people help decorate her tree! Did someone get her drunk again or?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Having a perfectly decorated tree is not what Christmas is about. It’s about being with the people that you love.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is nice and we’re done. TADA!
(Her side of the tree looks a complete mess)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I dunno what it is, it just doesn’t quite feel like Christmas to me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, here.
(She turns the tree around so that her side, which is perfectly decorated, is showing)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See now it feels like Christmas!

content.description: Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe and Joey are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: … and that’s the story of the dreidle. Now, some people trace the Christmas tree back to the Egyptians, who used to bring green palm branches into their huts on the shortest day of the year, symbolising life’s triumph over death. And that was like 4000 years ago.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, pretty much around the same time that you started telling this story.
(Joey enters)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Joe what’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I had to get out of the apartment. Janine is like stretching all over the place. Y’know, everywhere I look she’s like… (He imitates her stretching)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can see why that’s hard to resist.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I like her so much!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aw, I’m sorry sweetie that she doesn’t feel the same way.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. And she’s so sweet. I just wanna feed her grapes and brush her hair.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are aware that she’s not a monkey, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am so over Janine. I mean, yeah, at first I thought she was hot, but now she’s like OLD NEWS!
(Janine enters)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Janine!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I just got a call to be a dancer on a television special for New Year’s Eve. It’s called some sort of Dick’n Rock’n Dickie Eve.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hold it! Are you talking about Dick Clark’s New Year’s Rocking Eve ?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Yeah, that’s what I said.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! We love that show! I mean Ross and I have been watching it since I can remember!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, you’re still just a little fat girl inside aren’t you? (He kisses her on the cheek)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well I’m gonna be on it this year. I’m gonna be one of the party people.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re gonna be a party person! Those guys rock the most!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well they said I should bring someone. (To Joey) Do you wanna be my dance partner?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Totally! I would love to spend New Year’s with you.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well actually they’re taping tomorrow. I don’t really understand why.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, well you see how it works is, the part with Dick Clark in Times Square is actually live, but they tape some of the party stuff ahead of time. Yeah, not a lot of people know that.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Yeah well, do you guys wanna come too?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We are there!
(Rachel laughs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What, what are you laughing at?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I used to date him, but you’re still going out with her!
(Gunther brings Janine a coffee)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Thanks. (To Monica and Ross) Great so we can all go together! I gotta run. Catch you later!
(Janine leaves)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye Janine!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did she just ask me out on a date?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about? She just invited him to the biggest party of the millennium!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but she also invited you and Ross. Yeah, honey, I’m sorry, but I don’t think that was a romantic thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Maybe. But hey I know how I can find out. We’re going to a New Year’s Eve party, right? So at midnight, I can kiss her. And if she kisses me back, great! Y’know? But if she says ‘Dude, what the hell are you doing?’ I can say ‘It wasn’t me, it was New Years!’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, that’s a lot better than Ross trying to kiss me in High School, and saying that he did it because he needed chapstick.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was a dry day.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We are going to Dick Clark’s New Year’s Rocking Eve !

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.description: The Set, Joey, Janine, Ross and Monica are walking in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: OK, listen I’ve been on sets before, so let me give you a little advice, alright? It’s a show, but we’re just dancing, OK? It’s no big deal. The important thing to remember — stay cool.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Got it!
(They get to the main stage)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God it’s just like I dreamed it!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: OK, everyone gather up.
(Monica and Ross push to the front)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘Scuse us

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Here’s what’s gonna happen. The music’s gonna start, you’re gonna dance, we’re gonna tape, you don’t look at the camera. Any questions?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I have a question. When is this gonna air?
(He and Monica laugh)

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Uh, yeah. Now you guys dance over there, you guys over there, and I want you two right around here, and everyone else spread out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross! So when is it gonna air?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s apartment, Chandler is there. Phoebe and Rachel enter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you look in the kitchen, I will look in the back closet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can save you time ladies, I’m right here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, Chandler why don’t you take a walk? This doesn’t concern you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We are looking for our Christmas presents from Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? That’s terrible!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, we do it every year!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh well, that makes it not terrible.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, yeah, we never find them! She’s always best at us that wily minx.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t worry, we’re just gonna search here for an hour, them we’re gonna go over to Joey’s and search, OK?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No not okay, you can’t look for Monica’s presents!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But we have to!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, you don’t have to, and you can’t because I live here too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well then, you should look with us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, aren’t you worried about what to get Monica for Christmas?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I have a great idea for a present for her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, that’s it? (Mimics Chandler) A great idea!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, that’s not enough. I mean what if she gets you a great present, two medium presents, and a bunch of little presents? And you’ve just gotten her one great present? I mean that’s just gonna make her feel bad. Why would you do that to her Chandler? Why? Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If I help, we can find ‘em faster!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s right!
(Phoebe looks under the couch)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh ooh, we have a live one!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s a Macy’s bag!
(Phoebe tips it upside down, and a shoe falls out)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, who’s it for?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Dear losers, do you really think I’d hide presents under the couch? P.S. Chandler, I knew they’d break you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-oh. She may be onto us.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We are so gonna find them this year.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know when you guys said you were gonna go across the hall and look, you don’t, you don’t do that every year do you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t, like go into the back of my closet, and look under my gym bag or anything?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, we never do that
(They turn away.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because that’s where Joey gave me some stuff to store that I’ve never seen before in my life! Okay, that did not just happen! (He does a weird clicky motion with his fingers, that kinda hard to describe.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, here comes another camera.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right. No biggie. Stay loose.
(As the camera passes by, they start to dance really rigid, but the camera is facing the other way.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why do they keep doing that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If we wanna get on camera, I think we have to get up on one of those platforms. They’ve been taping those people up there all day.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right.
(They move towards a platform, dancing really strangely as they go)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what’d you guys do to get up on there?

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: We learned how to dance.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah? Well when you learned how to dance did you forget how to put on underpants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!
(Camera pans to Joey and Janine)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Hey! You’re a good dancer!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Yeah, well you’d be better if you just loosened your hips a little.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Like this.
(She pulls Joey towards her and dances really close to him.)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: That’s it, feel the rhythm. That’s better.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Okay, you’re dancing with that girl over there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no-no we came together!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: I don’t see it. (To Janine) You are dancing with the tall guy over there. Tall guy, raise your hand! (He does. Janine goes over to him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no hey buddy, please let me dance with that girl, I really like her and I think I have a shot.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Really, y’think so? I don’t..
(He leaves, and this girl grabs Joey and starts dancing really wild.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s apartment, Phoebe and Rachel are there and Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I couldn’t find anything at Joey—Hey-hey, oh hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we found them. There were in the guest room closet behind some coats.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and you have nothing to worry about ‘cos they’re all crap!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Those are my gifts, I got them for you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh. Thanks Chandler they’re great!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well Chandler, what is this very weird, metal A Z thing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Those are book ends! That’s a great gift!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, I’m sorry, thank you for my azzz.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ha!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Make sure you put all that stuff back in the closet, okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, okay, oh, by the way, I just gotta say, I think it’s really nice of you that even after you’ve moved, you still keep storing that stuff for Joey!
(Chandler does the weird clicky thing again.)

content.description: The Set, the girl is still dancing with Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey dancer girl! Can I go to the bathroom? I just.. (The girl starts dancing really close to him, so he picks her up, twirls her round, and puts her against a platform) Here we go. (He walks away to find Monica and Ross doing a really out of place dance) Looking good Gellers!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We know!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, see that snippy guy over there? He’s the one who decides who gets up on the platform. We should go dance by him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.
(They dance over to him.)

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Okay, everybody hold!
(Ross and Monica high-five)

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Next on the platforms are… (He points to the right of Ross and Monica, so they dance over to where he’s pointing to. He points away from them) …you two! And… (He points the other way, and Ross and Monica follow his arm. Again he points away.) …You two!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Excuse me, sir, would it help if I weren’t wearing underpants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica! (Pause) Would it?
(The director shakes his head.)

content.description: The Men’s Bathroom, the tall guy is there as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Tall guy! Hey, listen, I wanted to talk to you about that girl that you’re dancing with.

content.speaker: Tall Guy
content.text: She’s nice, huh? To think I almost brought my wife to this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah, okay. Uh, look buddy, I came with that girl, and I had this plan to kiss her at the new years countdown — I’m trying to win her over, so I was wondering if..

content.speaker: Tall Guy
content.text: No I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh come on man, you can dance with my partner, she’s real, uh, mellow!

content.speaker: Tall Guy
content.text: Look, are you dating this girl you came with?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I was hoping after tonight that maybe I could you know…

content.speaker: Tall Guy
content.text: No, no. She’s fair game if you ask me, sorry buddy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, alright, hey y’know fair is fair, (he pretends to wash his hands) if you’re right, you’re right, what can I say, but hey oh no! (He throws water on the guy’s pants)

content.speaker: Tall Guy
content.text: God! What are you, in second grade?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, now you’re the one who wet his pants. (He throws another handful on him and runs out)

content.description: The Set, Monica and Ross are dancing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Man, this sucks! Y’know if Mom and Dad don’t see us on TV after we made them so jealous, I mean, who’s gonna be the losers then?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I know what’ll get us up on a platform!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The routine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, we haven’t done the routine since middle school.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, when the snippy guy sees the routine, he’ll wanna build us our own platform!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Was it really that good?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We got honourable mention in the brother/sister dance category! Look, it’s almost fake midnight, do we really have any other choice?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, let’s do it. Mom and Dad are gonna be so faced!
(They move into a space, and Ross points to his eyes and then to hers)
(They start the routine. However hard I try, I really cannot describe it. You will have to watch it. I’m sorry.)
(When they finish, they walk over to the director)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, do we really have to ask who’s going up on the platform next?

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Oh no! You get up there and do that again exactly like that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! (They run over to a platform)

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Make sure you get this, they’re gonna want it for the bloopers show. (To everyone) Alright cut! Listen up everyone, when we start again it’s gonna be the countdown to new years, so I wanna see everybody’s excitement.
[Cut to Joey and Janine]

content.speaker: Tall Guy
content.text: Hey, pal, you have about three seconds to get away from my partner.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: What’s going on over here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, take a look at the guy’s pants! I mean, I know you told us to show excitement, but don’t you think he went a little overboard?

content.speaker: Director
content.text: What’s the matter with you? Get out of here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, take a hike wetpants!
(The director pushes the Tall Guy away)
[Cut to Ross and Monica, who are finally on a platform!]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can you believe this? We’re gonna be on the platform for the Millennium moment!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! Hey, you haven’t been practising the routine, have you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me too!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, when the music starts up again, I was thinking of maybe goind into the robot, y’know? (He mimics a robot)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, I think we should stick to the routine, we don’t wanna look stupid!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Alright we’re back! Ten seconds left here we go! Ten! Nine! Eight! Seven! (He continues to count as we hear Joey think)

content.speaker: Joey’s Head
content.text: Okay, it all comes down to this. Whatever happens, happens. Destiny.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Three, Two, One!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Cut!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! Year! Happy No Year!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Okay, here’s where we go to the live shot of Times Square, nice work everyone that’s a wrap!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s apartment, Chandler and Rachel are there, and Phoebe enters with the Chick and the Duck.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Look who I found!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, hey guys!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, birds have a very good sense of direction, and I thought maybe they could help us find where the presents are hidden.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, if the presents are hidden south for the winter.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or we could just follow your clever jokes — any ideas? No! Didn’t think so! Okay, c’mon guys, show us where the presents are!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, the duck seems to think that Monica got me garbage! Hmm, I wonder what I could get Monica that’s as good as garbage?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm, how about my azzz?
(Rachel sits on the window seat, and knocks against it)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, this is hollow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This bench, it’s hollow! I can’t believe I never knew that! (She pushes all the pillows off it and opens it up) Oh, the presents!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, don’t look directly at them!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, no, we could look at them!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, this one’s for me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this one’s for Chandler. Here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And the big one’s for me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, let’s open them!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! Okay! Okay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hee hee!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait, we can’t do this.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t wanna know what Monica got me. Y’know? I mean, look, I’m sure she worked really hard at getting you a present, and wanting to surprise me, and you guys are gonna ruin that, and I, look we have to put these back, this is not what Christmas is about.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whatever Linus, I’m opening mine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nobody is opening anything ok? Look, I don’t know about you guys, but I wanna see the look on Monica’s face when I give her my present, and I’m sure she wants to see the look on my face when I get mine. So please, please, can we just, can we put them back?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Will you get us better gifts?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine!
(Monica enters, and they throw the gifts behind them.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys! You found the presents? Chandler, you let them find the presents? Great! Do you know how long it took me to find you that water purifier?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s what you got me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yes, I see what you mean. That look is priceless.
(Rachel leans over to look at him.)

content.description: Joey and Janine’s apartment, they both enter.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Home sweet home, huh? Nice to, uh, get back to reality. Plus we know how the New Year’s gonna go off. I guess there’s no reason for all that Y2K panic, y’know? Anyway, g’night!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: 3, 2, 1. (She kisses him) Happy New Year.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yoii. What was that for?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well, I don’t know tonight when they yelled cut and we didn’t get to kiss, I was really, really, disappointed, and I just, really wanted to kiss you

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? In the moment, I really wanted to kiss you too. In the moment.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: In the moment, yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But only in the moment. So do ya wanna kiss again?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Sure, New Year’s Eve is only two weeks away. Can you wait?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Me neither.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Joey, you don’t have to count down every time we kiss.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, yeah, okay. Except I sorta felt like I needed a couple of seconds to get ready.
(They kiss to the music of Auld Lang Syne)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s apartment, everyone except Joey is there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We were on the platform, ready to dance the world into the new Millennium, and the guy yelled ‘CUT!’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, wait, so you guys are telling me you actually did the routine from eighth grade?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. But of course we had to update it a little bit. (To Ross) Hey, by the way, great thinking about catching me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ‘Cos I was gonna say there’s no way you could’ve done the end the way you guys did it back then!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? We could do it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, I mean you were a lot bigger, I mean, stronger back then.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can do it, okay? Come on, let’s go. (She and Ross get up)

content.speaker: Monica and Ross
content.text: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 (Ross runs to be caught by Monica, but she moves out of the way)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t do it! (Ross falls into Monica’s room)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now you do that, you’re on TV.
